articles.headline: More Latinos Seek Citizenship to Vote Against Trump
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s harsh language against Mexican immigrants has compelled legal residents to seek citizenship in time to vote against him in November.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s harsh language against Mexican immigrants has compelled legal residents to seek citizenship in time to vote against him in November.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER — Donald J. Trump’s harsh campaign language against Mexican immigrants has helped him win a substantial delegate lead in the Republican primaries, but it is also mobilizing a different set of likely voters — six in the family of Hortensia Villegas alone.

articles.headline: Marco Rubio’s Campaign Echoes ’07 Tax Revolt: A Big Plan With Little Payoff
articles.snippet: In his biggest gamble as Florida House speaker, Marco Rubio tried to end residential property taxes, displaying tactical weaknesses but a disregard for entrenched systems.
articles.abstract: In his biggest gamble as Florida House speaker, Marco Rubio tried to end residential property taxes, displaying tactical weaknesses but a disregard for entrenched systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — It began with the audacity and promise of a rising political star. Marco Rubio, a young state lawmaker, was going to do what nobody had tried for decades: rewrite the bedeviling tax code in Florida and elevate his stature in the process.

articles.headline: U.S. Strikes in Somalia Kill 150 Shabab Fighters
articles.snippet: The strikes hit a camp where officials said fighters with the Shabab militant group were preparing an attack against American troops and their allies.
articles.abstract: The strikes hit a camp where officials said fighters with the Shabab militant group were preparing an attack against American troops and their allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American aircraft on Saturday struck a training camp in Somalia belonging to the Islamist militant group the Shabab, the Pentagon said, killing about 150 fighters who were assembled for what American officials believe was a graduation ceremony and prelude to an imminent attack against American troops and their allies in East Africa.

articles.headline: Ortega vs. the Contras: Nicaragua Endures an ’80s Revival
articles.snippet: Violent opposition from small groups of rebels reflects broader anger brewing against President Daniel Ortega as he has consolidated his power.
articles.abstract: Violent opposition from small groups of rebels reflects broader anger brewing against President Daniel Ortega as he has consolidated his power.
articles.lead_paragraph: NUEVA SEGOVIA, Nicaragua — He calls himself Tyson, wears tattered United States Army fatigues and carries a beat-up AK-47.

articles.headline: Hulk Hogan Takes Stand in His Sex-Tape Lawsuit Against Gawker
articles.snippet: The trial is the latest prominent legal battle highlighting the somewhat murky line between the right to privacy and the right to free speech.
articles.abstract: The trial is the latest prominent legal battle highlighting the somewhat murky line between the right to privacy and the right to free speech.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. — Taking the stand as the first witness in his $100 million invasion-of-privacy lawsuit against the website Gawker, the former wrestling champion Hulk Hogan told a jury on Monday that he had been “completely humiliated” by the public release of a video that showed him having sex with his now-former best friend’s wife.

articles.headline: Zika Risk? Probably Not Covered by Your Travel Policy
articles.snippet: Policies usually don’t include coverage for calling off a trip even if the traveler is at heightened risk from a disease outbreak like the Zika virus.
articles.abstract: Policies usually don’t include coverage for calling off a trip even if the traveler is at heightened risk from a disease outbreak like the Zika virus.
articles.lead_paragraph: Until recently, awareness of the Zika virus was largely limited to readers of infectious diseases guides who made it to the last page.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Laces Into Japan With a Trade Tirade From the ’80s
articles.snippet: In an attack reminiscent of another era, Mr. Trump has chastised Japan as a country where “we are getting absolutely crushed on trade.”
articles.abstract: In an attack reminiscent of another era, Mr. Trump has chastised Japan as a country where “we are getting absolutely crushed on trade.”
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Donald J. Trump has often aimed his raucous brand of disparagement at foreign countries during his presidential run. There is China, “ripping off” the United States on trade and stealing its jobs. And Mexico, closing its eyes to a flood of migrants and drugs across the border.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Soble and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: Justice Dept. Appeals Ruling in Apple iPhone Case in Brooklyn
articles.snippet: The Justice Department said a federal judge had erred in not ordering Apple to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone, in a case being watched by lawyers and experts on both sides of the encryption debate.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department said a federal judge had erred in not ordering Apple to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone, in a case being watched by lawyers and experts on both sides of the encryption debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the latest volley in its high-profile fight with Apple, the Justice Department said on Monday that a federal judge in Brooklyn had erred last week in refusing to order the company to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and Joseph Goldstein

articles.headline: Lurid Suit Over Hate Mail Embroils Isaac Perlmutter, Marvel Chief
articles.snippet: Isaac Perlmutter, the enigmatic head of the Marvel Entertainment unit of Disney, is accused of orchestrating a slander campaign that called a neighbor a murderer and child molester.
articles.abstract: Isaac Perlmutter, the enigmatic head of the Marvel Entertainment unit of Disney, is accused of orchestrating a slander campaign that called a neighbor a murderer and child molester.
articles.lead_paragraph: Scandals in Palm Beach, Fla., are as much a part of the landscape as Lilly Pulitzer and plastic surgery. In recent years, the wealthy enclave has been rocked by the Bernard L. Madoff Ponzi scheme and the Jeffrey Epstein underage-sex lawsuit, to name just two.

articles.headline: Hedge Funds Escalating Attacks on United Continental
articles.snippet: The former chief executive of Continental Airlines is one of six director candidates put forward by two activist hedge funds.
articles.abstract: The former chief executive of Continental Airlines is one of six director candidates put forward by two activist hedge funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: After years of seeing United Continental struggle, two hedge funds have begun an insurrection against the airline’s board — and have turned to a well-regarded figure from the company’s past to lead the charge.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Jad Mouawad
